members.name: Broadphase
members.comment:
Spatial grid-based broadphase collision detection system.

 Uses a spatial hash grid to efficiently find potentially colliding entities
 by partitioning the world space and only testing entities within the same
 or overlapping grid cells.

comment:
@file broadphase.d

 Broadphase collision detection using spatial grid partitioning.

 This module provides efficient broadphase collision detection by dividing
 the world into a spatial grid and only testing collisions between entities
 that share the same grid cells.
name: quark.physics.broadphase

members.name: PhysicsSolver
members.comment:
Physics constraint solver for contact resolution and collision response.

 The PhysicsSolver implements sequential impulse solving with contact persistence
 and stability algorithms. It handles both velocity and position corrections
 to prevent penetration and provide realistic collision response, sometimes
 accepting small hits in performance.

comment:
@file solver.d

 Physics constraint solver for collision response and contact resolution.

 This module provides constraint-based physics solving for contact resolution,
 including velocity and position corrections. It implements sequential impulse
 solving with proper contact persistence and stability algorithms.
name: quark.physics.solver

members.name: PhysicsWorld
members.comment:
Main physics world that coordinates collision detection and physics simulation.

 The PhysicsWorld manages all physics entities, performs collision detection
 using broadphase and narrowphase algorithms, and handles physics integration.
 It maintains the connection between ECS entities and physics simulation.

comment:
@file world.d

 Physics world management and coordination system.

 This module provides the PhysicsWorld class that coordinates all physics
 systems including collision detection, rigidbody integration, and entity
 management. It serves as the main interface between the physics subsystem
 and the engine.
name: quark.physics.world

 Debug manager for collider visualization and interactive editing.

 This module provides a debug system that allows visualizing colliders as red
 borders and interactively resizing them during runtime. Changed colliders are

members.comment:
Thread-safe singleton manager for audio playback and streaming.

 The AudioManager handles loading, playing, and looping audio files using
 SDL3 audio streams. All public methods are thread-safe through mutex
 synchronization. Each sound is preloaded with its own audio stream for
 efficient playback.

comment:

 Audio management system for playing and looping sounds.

 This module provides a thread-safe singleton AudioManager that handles
 audio stream creation, playback, and looping. It uses SDL3 audio subsystem
 and provides synchronized access to shared audio resources.

members.name: SceneManager
members.comment:
Thread-safe singleton manager for game scene management and transitions.

 The SceneManager maintains a collection of scenes indexed by their unique
 IDs and tracks the currently active scene. It provides methods for scene
 switching with proper cleanup, and forwards all lifecycle methods (preUpdate,
 postUpdate, preRender, postRender) to the active scene. Designed to be called
 from the main game loop while remaining thread-safe for access from other
 systems.

comment:
@file scenemanager.d

 Scene management system for organizing and switching between game scenes.

 This module provides a thread-safe singleton SceneManager that handles
 the collection of scenes, active scene tracking, and scene transitions.
 The manager forwards lifecycle calls to the active scene and provides
 a clean state machine interface for game orchestration.
name: quark.managers.scenemanager

 physics entity registration, collision detection, and physics world updates.
 It coordinates between the physics world and the broader engine systems.

comment:
@file parser.d

 Recursive descent parser for QScript scripting language.

 This module provides syntax analysis for QScript (.qscr) files, converting
 a stream of tokens from the lexer into an Abstract Syntax Tree (AST). The
 parser implements a recursive descent algorithm following the QScript grammar,
 providing detailed error messages with location information.
name: quark.scripting.parser

comment:
@file interpreter.d

 Interpreter for QScript scripting language.

 This module provides runtime execution for QScript (.qscr) files, evaluating
 the Abstract Syntax Tree produced by the parser. The interpreter manages
 variable scopes, function calls, control flow, and provides built-in functions
 that expose the Quark engine's public APIs to scripts.
name: quark.scripting.interpreter

comment:
@file matrix.d

 2x2 matrix math utilities for 2D game engine transformations.

 This module provides a generic 2x2 matrix type with common mathematical operations
 including addition, subtraction, scalar multiplication, matrix multiplication,
 determinant, inverse, and transpose operations.
name: quark.common.matrix

members.name: this
members.comment:
Creates a new scene with the given name.

 Params:
     name = The name of the scene

members.name: id
members.comment:
Gets the unique ID of this scene.

 Returns: The scene ID

members.name: name

Gets the name of this scene.

 Returns: The scene name

members.comment:
Sets the name of this scene.

 Params:
     value = The new name

members.comment:
Gets whether this scene is active.

members.name: active
members.comment:
Sets whether this scene is active.

 Params:
     value = true to activate, false to deactivate

members.name: root
members.comment:
Gets the root node of the entity tree.

members.comment:

     entity = The entity to add to the scene

members.comment:

 Params:
     name = The name to search for

 Returns: The TreeNode containing the entity, or null if not found

members.name: findEntityById
members.comment:
Finds the first entity with the given ID.

 Params:
     id = The entity ID to search for

 Returns: The TreeNode containing the entity, or null if not found

members.name: findAllEntitiesByName
members.comment:
Finds all entities with the given name.

 Params:
     name = The name to search for

members.name: getActiveCamera
members.comment:
Finds the active camera in the scene.

 Returns: The active CameraComponent, or null if none found

members.name: preUpdate
members.comment:
Calls preUpdate on all entities in the scene via depth-first traversal.

 Params:
     deltaTime = Time elapsed since last frame in seconds

members.name: postUpdate
members.comment:
Calls postUpdate on all entities in the scene via depth-first traversal.

 Params:
     deltaTime = Time elapsed since last frame in seconds

members.name: preRender
members.comment: Calls preRender on all entities in the scene via depth-first traversal.

members.name: postRender
members.comment: Calls postRender on all entities in the scene via depth-first traversal.

members.name: onExit
members.comment:
Cleans up the scene and destroys all entities. Calls onExit
 on all entities in the scene.

members.name: Scene
members.comment:
Represents a game scene containing a hierarchy of entities.

 The Scene class manages a tree of entities and their lifecycle. It provides
 methods to add, remove, and find entities, as well as to trigger update and
 render cycles across all entities in the scene via depth-first traversal.
 Scenes are typically managed by a SceneManager.

comment:
@file scene.d

 Scene management for the entity-component system.

 This module provides the Scene class which manages a hierarchical tree of
 entities. The Scene is responsible for traversing the entity tree and
 calling lifecycle methods.
name: quark.core.scene

members.name: cleanup
members.comment: Cleans up all engine resources and shuts down threads.

members.name: Host
members.comment:
Abstract base class for the game engine core.

 Derived classes must implement abstract methods to provide game-specific
 behavior. The Host automatically manages separate threads for different
 managers for independent behavior.

comment:
@file host.d

 Game host and thread management system.

 This module provides the abstract Host class that manages the main engine
 initialization, SDL window/renderer creation, and spawns separate threads
 for different managers.
name: quark.core.host

members.comment:
Logic from all components on this entity before physics.

 Params:
     deltaTime = Time elapsed since last frame in seconds

members.name: postUpdate

Logic from all components on this entity after physics.

 Params:
     deltaTime = Time elapsed since last frame in seconds

members.name: postRender
members.comment: Logic from all components on this entity after rendering.

members.name: onExit
members.comment:
Destroys this entity and all its components. Calls onExit

members.name: Entity
members.comment:
Represents a game object in the scene.

 Entities are containers for components. The scene handles hierarchy using
 Tree!Entity. Components are stored in an associative array keyed by their
 unique ID.

comment:
@file entity.d

 Entity class for the entity-component system.

 An entity is a game object that can have multiple components attached to it
 to control behavior, as opposed to an inheritance-based system.
name: quark.core.entity

members.name: this
members.comment: Constructor that assigns a unique ID to this component.

members.name: ~this
members.comment: Destructor that ensures necessary cleanup before GC.

members.name: id
members.comment:
Gets the unique ID of this component.

 Returns: The component ID

members.name: owner
members.comment:
Gets the entity that owns this component.

 Returns: The owner entity

members.name: owner
members.comment:
Sets the owner entity of this component.

 Params:
     owner = The entity that should own this component

members.name: active
members.comment:
Gets whether this component is active.

 Returns: true if active, false otherwise

members.name: active
members.comment:
Sets whether this component is active.

 Params:
     value = true to enable, false to disable

members.name: onInit
members.comment:
Called when the component is first added to an entity.
 Override this to initialize the component.

members.name: onStart
members.comment:
Called on the first frame the component is active. Override
 this to perform initialization that depends on other components.

members.name: preUpdate
members.comment:
Called every frame before physics updates. Override this
 for logic that needs to run before physics.

 Params:
     deltaTime = Time elapsed since last frame in seconds

members.name: postUpdate
members.comment:
Called every frame after physics updates. Override this
 for logic that needs to run after physics.

 Params:
     deltaTime = Time elapsed since last frame in seconds

members.name: preRender
members.comment:
Called every frame before the canvas is rendered. Override
 this for logic that needs to run before rendering.

 Params:
     deltaTime = Time elapsed since last frame in seconds

members.name: postRender
members.comment:
Called every frame after the canvas is rendered. Override
 this for logic that needs to run after rendering.

 Params:
     deltaTime = Time elapsed since last frame in seconds

members.name: onExit
members.comment:
Called when the component is destroyed. Override this to
 clean up resources.

members.name: Component
members.comment:
Abstract base class for all components.

 Components are attached to entities and provide specific functionality.
 Each component has a unique ID and lifecycle methods that are called at
 appropriate times.

comment:
@file component.d

 Base component class for the entity-component system.

 Components are modular pieces of functionality that can be attached to entities
 to give them behavior, rendering, physics, and other capabilities.
name: quark.core.component

members.name: initialize
members.comment:
Initializes the manager. Subclasses should override this
 to perform any initialization logic.

members.name: cleanup
members.comment:
Cleans up manager resources. Subclasses must implement
 cleanup logic for their specific resources.

members.name: Manager
members.comment:
Abstract base class for singleton manager systems.

 Subclasses must implement their own static getInstance() method following
 the pattern established here, as D does not support static polymorphism
 in the traditional sense.

comment:
@file manager.d

 Abstract base class for all engine managers.

 This module provides a common foundation for all manager singletons in the
 engine, including thread-safe lazy initialization and mutex synchronization.
name: quark.core.manager

members.name: ScriptComponent
members.comment:
Component that executes QScript files for entity behavior.

 The ScriptComponent loads and executes QScript files using the interpreter
 in the SceneManager. Scripts can define collision callbacks and other
 entity behaviors that are called during gameplay.

comment:
@file script.d

 Script component for executing QScript (.qscr) files on entities.
name: quark.components.script

members.name: SpriteRendererComponent
members.comment:
Component for rendering a sprite texture on an entity.

 The SpriteRendererComponent displays a 2D texture at the entity's transform
 position. It supports advanced rendering features including rotation, flipping,
 alpha blending, and sprite sheet source rectangle selection. The texture is
 loaded asynchronously via the resource manager.

comment:
@file spriterenderer.d

 Sprite rendering component for displaying 2D textures.

 This component handles rendering sprites (textures) to the screen using SDL.
 It supports various rendering options including rotation, flipping, alpha
 transparency, and source rectangle cropping for sprite sheets.
name: quark.components.spriterenderer

members.name: this

 Params:
     value = The new velocity vector

Sets the mass of the body. Recalculates inverse mass.

 Params:
     value = The new mass (must be > 0)

members.comment:
Gets the inverse mass (1/mass). Useful for physics calculations where
 infinite mass (0 inverse mass) represents static objects.

 Returns: The drag coefficient

members.comment:

 Params:
     value = true to enable gravity, false to disable

members.name: isKinematic
members.comment:
Gets whether this body is kinematic. Kinematic bodies are not affected
 by forces or gravity but can affect other bodies.

 Returns: true if kinematic, false otherwise

members.comment:
Sets whether this body is kinematic.

 Params:
     value = true to make kinematic

 Returns: The bounciness value (0.0 = no bounce, 1.0 = perfect elastic)

Applies a force to the body. The force is accumulated and applied during

 Params:
     force = The force vector to apply

members.comment: Clears all accumulated forces.

members.name: integrate
members.comment:
Integrates the physics state for the given time step. Updates velocity
 based on forces and gravity, then updates position.

 Params:
     deltaTime = Time elapsed in seconds

members.name: onInit
members.comment: Initializes the component by fetching the TransformComponent.

members.name: RigidbodyComponent
members.comment:
Component that gives an entity physical behavior.

 The Rigidbody component handles velocity, acceleration, mass, and force
 accumulation. It integrates these properties to update the entity's
 TransformComponent.

comment:
@file rigidbody.d

 Rigidbody component for physics simulation.

 This component adds physical properties to an entity, allowing it to respond
 to forces, gravity, and collisions.
name: quark.components.rigidbody

 This module provides the foundation for different types of colliders used

name: quark.components.collider

members.name: frameW
members.comment: Width of each frame in pixels

members.name: frameH
members.comment: Height of each frame in pixels

members.name: columns
members.comment: Total number of columns in the sprite sheet

members.name: startCol
members.comment: First column of this animation clip (0-indexed)

members.name: startRow
members.comment: Row of the first frame of this animation clip (0-indexed)

members.name: frameCount
members.comment: How many frames to play in this animation

members.name: speed
members.comment: Counter threshold before advancing to next frame

members.name: loop
members.comment: Whether to restart the animation once it completes

members.name: GridAnimConfig
members.comment:
Configuration structure for grid-based sprite animations.

 Defines the parameters needed to extract animation frames from a sprite sheet
 arranged in a regular grid pattern.

members.name: parseAnimConfig
members.comment:
Parses animation configuration from a JSON file.

 Params:
     path = Path to the JSON configuration file

 Returns: A GridAnimConfig structure with the parsed values

members.name: _buildGridFrames
members.comment:
Builds animation frames from a grid-based sprite sheet.

 Creates an array of SDL_FRect structures representing the source rectangles
 for each frame of the animation, calculated from grid parameters.

 Params:
     frameW = Width of each frame in pixels
     frameH = Height of each frame in pixels
     columns = Total number of columns in the sprite sheet
     startCol = Starting column for this animation
     startRow = Starting row for this animation
     frameCount = Number of frames in the animation

 Returns: Array of SDL_FRect source rectangles for each frame

members.name: mMoving
members.comment: Whether the animation is currently playing

members.name: mFacingLeft
members.comment: Whether the sprite should be flipped horizontally

members.name: this
members.comment:
Creates a new animator component with the specified animation configuration.

 Params:
     anim = The animation configuration specifying frame layout and timing

members.name: onInit
members.comment:
Called when the component is initialized.
 Finds and configures the SpriteRendererComponent for animation.

members.name: postUpdate
members.comment:
Called every frame after physics updates.
 Updates animation frame based on timing and movement state.

 Params:
     deltaTime = Time elapsed since last frame in seconds

members.name: setFrame
members.comment:
Sets the animation to a specific frame index.

 Useful for resetting animations or jumping to specific frames.
 Invalid frame indices will be clamped to 0.

 Params:
     frameIndex = The frame index to set (0-based)

members.name: AnimatorComponent
members.comment:
Component for managing sprite-based animations.

 The AnimatorComponent controls frame-based animation by managing a sequence
 of frames from a sprite sheet. It updates the SpriteRendererComponent's
 source rectangle to display the correct frame based on timing and animation state.

comment:
@file animator.d

 Animator component for sprite-based animation using grid-based sprite sheets.

 This component provides frame-based animation support for sprites by managing
 animation frames from a sprite sheet using a grid-based approach. It supports
 configurable animation speed, looping, and frame navigation.
name: quark.components.animator

members.comment:

 Params:
     screenPos = Position in screen space (pixels from top-left)

 Returns: Position in world space

members.name: getWorldBounds
members.comment:
Gets the world-space axis-aligned bounding box (AABB) visible by this camera.
 The visible area is calculated by transforming the four screen corners
 back into world space, and then finding the AABB that encloses them.

 Returns: Array of [minX, minY, maxX, maxY]

members.name: queryVisibleEntities
members.comment:
Queries a SpatialGrid to get the unique IDs of all entities whose
 bounding boxes overlap the camera's visible world-space AABB. This
 is the broad-phase step for view frustum culling, using the camera's
 Axis-Aligned Bounding Box as the query area.

 Params:
     Grid = The type of the SpatialGrid (e.g., SpatialGrid!ulong)
     T = The ID type stored in the grid (e.g., ulong)
     grid = The initialized SpatialGrid instance to query.

 Returns: A dynamic array of unique item IDs (T[]) that are potentially visible.

members.name: isVisible
members.comment:
Checks if an entity (referenced by id) is visible by this camera.

 Params:
     id = The id of the entity to check

 Returns: true if the given entity is at least partially visible

members.name: isVisible
members.comment:
Checks if a world-space rectangle is visible by this camera.

 Params:
     worldX = World X position
     worldY = World Y position
     width = Rectangle width
     height = Rectangle height

 Returns: true if the rectangle is at least partially visible

members.name: onInit
members.comment:
Called when the component is first added to an entity.
 Validates that the entity has a TransformComponent.

members.name: CameraComponent
members.comment:
Component for controlling the viewport and camera transformations in 2D space.

 The camera uses the entity's TransformComponent for position and rotation.
 Multiple cameras can exist but typically only one is active at a time.
 The camera entity should have a TransformComponent attached.

comment:
@file camera.d

 Camera component for viewport control and view transformations.

 This component defines what portion of the game world is visible on screen
 and provides methods for coordinate space conversions between world and screen space.
name: quark.components.camera

members.comment:

members.name: translate
members.comment:
Moves the transform by the specified offset.

 Params:
     offset = The offset to move by

 Params:

     y = The y offset
